intro: Ricinus borboniensis, commonly known as the Madagascar castor, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and distinctive yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces a capsule that contains toxic seeds, similar to other members of the Ricinus genus. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas within its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
